solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times _{j}_^2 = _{{5*(6*(Decimal(str(j))**2))}}_ cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(_{j}_^2 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = _{{5*(6*(Decimal(str(j))**2))}}_ - _{{10*(Decimal(str(j))**2)}}_ = _{{(5*(6*(Decimal(str(j))**2)))-(10*(Decimal(str(j))**2))}}_ \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs _{k}_ per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(_{{(5*(6*(Decimal(str(j))**2)))-(10*(Decimal(str(j))**2))}}_ \times _{k}_\)
= Rs. _{{((5*(6*(Decimal(str(j))**2)))-(10*(Decimal(str(j))**2)))*k}}_

content.text: Five cubes of edge _{j}_ cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs _{k}_ per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object? (in Rupees)
